header.topics: Discussing the restaurant menu, ordering in ‘Ponglish’, shopping in Poland, the working week, drinking water, ‘yummy mummies’ & people posing, portrait studios/sales, arrangements to see friends, wifi, teacher colleagues, where to have coffee, chocolate, children, paying the bill, new socks, a native colleague, learning a language, facebook culling, vultures, sewing.
header.activity: Two friends talking about various topics (see 9 above) in the Soprano restaurant in Tarnow, Poland.

speaker.occupation: unemployed/ Some part-time private TEFL teacher/ Semi-retired
Teacher of English as a foreign Language

body.u: I'm just looking at a menu
okay there's quite a lot of that goes on at the at the beginning of our audios I know
very quiet going to have to talk talk to fill the time while I just er
looking looking at menus I'm sure I can do that
so yes I'm going for the big juice number four which is about three quid but I don't really care cos I really hate paying for water
spicy curry fish with with spicy curry spicy spicy curry soup with white fish and prawns that sounds nice
but I don't want a soup
get a little bit sort of curious here about erm the quality of the fish
I th wwell it's gonna be frozen isn't it?
yep and if it's frozen when it's
we're not exactly near the sea
fresh then it's not so bad but we don't know where or when
this occurred but the I think the prawns are really good mm
pumpkin tagliatelle with prosciutto and cumin
the veggie-friendly pasta whichever one it was is delicious
I'm just looking they've changed their menu since we were er here last
salmon I don't think any of these are vegetarian
no they're not they've taken off the veggie option it I think it was a penne pasta with
something or other oh that's really naughty
I had one with mustard that's gone as well
mind you they have added a vegan risotto
I'll kind of let them off
I just don't know what to have I just don't know this menu is in no order is it?
it's a little bit on the random side you get a va
you get a vague heading I think the main meals are broken up into pizza pasta fish that type of stuff
cos I've not had any of these things
oh will it be spicy chicken? probably yes
was there any point in looking at the menu? spicy chicken
it's rea it really is the best thing
and I've not had it for ages one of the I had a really nice one of these salads that is not on the menu anymore
this bloody menu they've changed everything I don't know whether I'm coming or going right yeah spicy chicken fuck it
and a juice number number one
big or small? I'm going large
what's that? it's not even that much is it? it's not even half a litre
no well it's nearly a pint
er er and juice number one
er oh is it in there? it's not in there
going to have to do this er the menu's not the same uhu
erm er where's my gone? which one was the beetroot? just to make sure I don't get the wrong one it's this one isn't it?
oh that was a lot of words
er I need to have a look
look at the sides I can't remember what any of these words mean
I think she's the only probably the person under twenty-five in the whole of Poland that has no English
sorry transorry transcribers just ignore the last five minutes with a bit of Ponglish
cos usually someone manages to say something in
in English maybe she's just like really resistant
I always find if I if if I'm in a shop I usually ask well well I search out an under twenty-five-year-old
and I was in yesterday looking for bubble wrap to wrap up all my
it was hilarious so I found a young woman and er I cos you just sort of presume your chances of finding someone
with a bit of English it's vastly improved if you've got a younger person anyway she had a little bit of English and I dunno I was sort of miming it and
sort of doing the pop pop pop

and say erm moving house and packing wrapping careful you know breaking glass and things like that and pop pop pop and then sort of miming sort of squeezing this bubble wrap or treading on it and going ha ha ha

well I didn't get arrested thankfully erm and you know yyou probably know when you're in retail places I've worked in Sainsbury's and what have you if a customer asks you have to take them to the object and point at it and say you know is this what you want? is this your mustard? or your whatever and so she took me to various things for like erm
and things like that no no no no and then erm I think they must've had a delivery in and there was somebody erm unwrapping something that had a lot of cling film type stuff round it
so I sort of lifted it up and went pop pop pop and she went ah
light bulb moment led me right the other end to the shop I think we both walked miles me sort of running after her with my trolley
and found this bubble wrap and we were both absolutely delighted we almost did a little jig of joy
the bubble wrap was there yeah it was great
yeah part of the joy of being in another culture I suppose I do feel a bit bad about not having much of the language but
but that is a word that nobody would know in another language
I know bubble wrap I know and my Polish phone's up the spout otherwise I could've used
Google Translate but it's doing really weird things where the battery'll be full and then I'll blink and then it'll be empty
and it'll take ages to charge again
so I'm a bit annoyed with it but all of the credit runs out end of March
so I might just let it run out and not bother we'll see
ah what other news have I got? I've this week has flown I've really not even I've not had yesterday no on Thursday it was just like I haven't had time to wash my hair you know I I have time to eat
but that's about as far as it gets eat and try to like squeeze in going to the gym but I really have to ssort of stress a lot about it
is that cos of mocks and marking?
no I've not even had time to look at the marking
it was because I was doing 's classes
's classes how many did you do for him?
erm so it meant all my one-to-ones were moved forward
so I had two in the court two hours in the court a tiny gap two one to ones and then two ninety-minute lessons so it worked out at eight point six six
but that was on top of like Wednesday which is my busiest day
so it was just like trying to find the time to to plan these
so technically if you planned for as long as you taught in a two-day period you'd probably hit
I've just got all my marking to do and then just not I need to do it by Monday
just you know I don't care
I know it will and yeah I'm allowed one bloody day off a week so
er so yeah but I enjoyed those lessons it's
that FM one 's those class you share with
are they the ones in the small room that's got and lovely ?
erm it has in it erm with the big hair
who's a pain in the arse
really went off on one with him
I was like you're just making yourselves look stupid blah blah blah blah blah
stop trying to show off in front of everyone you look like a dick
they don't know what dick means they can guess from the context
I'm sure they do know what dick means but even so
no and there was so many I thought they're not my class I can say what I want like
so I really went to town on him
er cos he was just being a knob like
I wouldn't mind as much if he was just like really clever doing his work then pissing about but he's doing his work and pissing about but getting it all wrong
and there's some n super-nice kids in that class
I really like him a lot
his eyes I was like you're so handsome you're so beautiful
he's just like got the biggest he's like you know like horse's eyes or cow's eyes like really big
yeah it's the big eyelashes that go with it isn't it? and the big hair
he's so funny on one of his first lessons he was trying to sneakily eat rice cakes in class
but er under the table and then passing them round and I was like you know if you're hungry just eat
just don't get any crumbs everywhere or clean up after yourselves
those poor kids have been slaving away since dawn
I know in my yeah in all of my first lessons I was like please eat I'd rather you eat and you have a bit more
than you're like dozing off at the back
I think they're all camels I think everybody in Poland is bred to be a camel
I was doing health and fitness yesterday and discussion club and one of the questions was I drink several
er glasses of water a day
they were like oh no I drink tea it's like what?
they were like how much water do you drink? I was like three litres four litres
a minimum of five pints of water a day

cos I just keep filling up my pint glass and I was talking to about this and cos I I said you know I like that you drink water he drinks a pint of water during a one hour lesson and I do as well and I was saying you know I like that you do that I said today I probably had or will have about eight of these and he nearly fell off the sofa you know he said eight? you know couldn't quite
they think it's crazy I think it's because they don't drink tap water
so if you're drinking so much water and you're buying bottles or
then it's like but you're wasting money when you could have tea which is from the tap boiled
I've been drinking tap water here and I've not died yet so I really
think that it's safe to drink
yeah I was drinking tap water in Krakow which is probably a lot worse with all the industrial stuff
and it was fine that was for five weeks
and then here I've there was a little Brita filter still in the house so I use that
erm which is fine and then oh this I'm really excited by this on Monday I'm getting a UPS delivery of a little water filter that's like a mobile one
it weighs a kilo and it's about a foot twelve inches high erm but you can filter even river water
and it's got a carbon filter that lasts on average eleven years before it needs to be replaced
now it's a hundred and fifty quid
but I figure eleven years worth of not buying plastic bottled water while travelling
out and about and don't know what water quality's like
so yeah and erm as part of the promotion you get a free in inverted commas er plastic gym bottle now I don't like plastic bottles
I have the metal Sigg bottles as you know but it promises faithfully that there's no leakage of any
and that's also got a filter in it
bloody brilliant so I'm just amazed
that the technology is there these days
relatively lightweight thing you can stick in a rucksack
lots of well a few of my friends have these filter gym bottles
I don't know if they work or
how good the s the filter is
it's like a bobbly thing yeah yeah
but er no I don't know
when I stayed with in Australia he bought me one of those and it was just the whole plastic bottle thing
I couldn't get around I mean the temperature was about forty degrees while I was there so that could've been part of it so
wherever your bottle was even in the shade it was just
warm and plasticky and not good
warm water in a metal bottle still tastes not as bad as warm water

in a plastic bottle but anyway we'll see so I'm excited by that because when I've been sort of er you know I don't know if necessarily I'll be living in the van I probably won't but when I've been erm I had a tour around Ireland for about a month and lived in the van this is going back a year or two now might even've been a couple of years I suppose and the biggest problem I had was well one showering so needing to find somewhere to shower every fourth day usually
erm and getting clean drinking water
and quite often like if you had a meal somewhere they didn't mind filling up a big
thing for you but my van holds I think it's about twenty litres
erm so now I can fill that up and just filter off from that what I need
water is not a problem and theoretically I'm gonna be somewhere warm enough I've got a little erm plastic bag with a small solar panel on it
so it heats the water so you fill the bag with water leave it outside the van in the sun and you can shower off of that
yeah and I've invested in a actually my brother and my niece bought me it for Christmas or gave me money for it erm a little solar panel that erm then charges a little power bank
and then I can plug USB devices
into that so so I should have shower clean water and solar power for charging the phone erm on the road which I'm really pleased about

happy days this mother over here it's her daughter's birthday and there's loads of little girls and they're having their you know birthday party in upstairs which I think is sort of the least child-friendly place
and she's taking so many photos on her big expensive camera which I presume she's gonna put on Facebook and show all her friends and family you know how what a nice mother she is
is this the Polish yummy mummy equivalent?
oh well I have a s
just makes me a bit sad
I have an old school friend on Facebook who's so like that and I can't help but like her
cos there's something you know she you see her posing in photographs and she's always doing that funny thing where she's sort of on the side sticking out a leg and pouting a bit
it just makes me laugh but
and she's got cutest little kitten
so I'm always commenting on her kitten photos
and when she puts up cutesy pictures of the children I usually comment yeah yeah
very nice but where's the cat?
where's the cat? I was in the gym
changing room the other day and this girl was taking pictures of herself like posing in the mirror
er and it was like I just ignored her and then she said to me in Polish oh do you mind taking my picture? and I was like and then like so I was showing her and she's like no no no again
she's like no no no again and she was like really giving it all this
and I was like you it's fine you look beautiful you look beautiful she was like thank you thank you
and then she just kept bowing
I was like this is just the weirdest situation and I was like dripping with sweat and bright red and she was like oh posing so much it's
that's hilarious I saw a similar thing to that
in that big park near to you
I saw a young man and a young woman and she was pulling all sorts of poses by trees in winter
and he was being like a semi-professional photographer
like lots of my Polish friends on Facebook have professional-looking profile pictures like
they've been to someone who's had it done and one of them one of the girls from the gym has pictures of her and her daughter with like a green screen in the background
I don't know like a New York skyline or something
and er her and her daughter are wearing matching outfits
like so like I just don't get it I just don't get it
I can't imagine english people doing that
I know people who have these sort of professional studio photos done
er and it's like you know these awful ones with white backgrounds and they're all like lying on the ground with their head like this
and you just think oh for god's sake stop
I had a job for a week selling those
yeah I worked up in in this tiny upstairs hovel working for portrait studio the largest portrait studio in the world and
well apparently so erm I presume there are so many franchises that's probably the issue
and er over the course of a week it was torture erm cold-calling basically having people telling you to fuck off or you know
all the sorts of things that I no longer say to people when they cold-call me erm yeah and I managed to sell one portrait package which was to a woman that I'd worked with five years previously
so yeah that was quite amusing
yeah I hated that job and I promised myself I would never ever ever again work in sales
and I haven't well yeah I've done retail sales but then
always with the attitude of I ignore targets I don't engage with targets
yeah and those people would buy the stuff anyway
they don't need to er be sort of persuaded to buy a pint of milk
yeah I'm very happy to say you know can I interest you in? or our special offer of the week is
yeah we've got a pryeah we've got a promotion on this
but yeah I respect people's free will and I'm not
not happy to try and persuade somebody to buy something
oh well all good fun yeah
I think these professional photos part of that might even be a like central European thing or a

mainland Europe thing yeah cos I know friends in Germany do it as well and erm it was one of my one-to-ones actually young Polish guy was doing his er getting his provisional driving licence and he had to have an ear showing
what? to show you've got ears?
to show you have ears yeah you had to have this shot that's like
you still need to see both
your eyes and everything but you have to show an ear and I think that's really common and also they attach photographs to CVs here
yeah I've got a photo on my CV
yeah and I was talking to about that ages ago and she said cos I've noticed the prevalence of portrait studios around

they are everywhere and she said you just wander in it's normally upstairs in somebody's apartment in their living room or something and they've got this professional setup set up and they've got all of the equipment so they take the photo once you agree yes that's the shot that I want they push a button and it gets processed through a machine then pops out four identical photos
so it's like they've had to pay for the equipment but
yeah er well I've got a photo on my CV for teaching but it isn't a professional ph it's just like a picture of me on a night out like just my face
so you can't see it it's just like my face looking happy
I'm not go into a studio
I had to put one on my CV for when I applied for here so I just scanned my passport photo so you can still see either
the stamp or the hologram or whatever it is
yes it's definitely your face oh pizza for the table these kids are eating pizza I can't stop
that was nice pizza the other night I enjoyed that
so tomorrow I'm not so sure how you guys are gonna be fixed for that cos 's still not in the best of health by the sounds of things
you've got Monday to prepare for
I I don't care about Monday
I'd rather do something if erm if you're up for it?
yeah yeah I'm up for it no worries yeah as long as it's not gonna be a big stress for you guys and I'm er really happy to be chauffeur if
you know 's not able to drive
or if she probably didn't ought to be driving then yeah I can pick all of you up and drop all of you off it's not a bother
you know in here it says there is wi-fi and then there just isn't
I'm on it I was getting notifications earlier so

no that's what I'm saying cos I'm connected to the wi-fi

why do people breed? don't do it no so I can't find out what the password is after the event can I?

yeah so need to get the bus back

no I didn't he bailed because his granny died and he's
yeah I saw that I saw that he'd flown but I thought
yeah yeah yeah no he bailed but you know that's fair enough
it sounds like 's not brilliant at the minute
he sounds pretty down about not having found work
poor do you think he'll come back?
cos he hasn't exactly got a lot of stuff has he? he brought it all over in a big rucksack to start with
yeah and I know he has bought some clothes here since but it crossed my mind if he might if that might've crossed his mind to take everything home and disappear
I don't I think he'd be the the sort of person who would s come back I think he would I dunno 's mum erm fell down some stairs in Warsaw
she's erm sh ththis is what told me so like doesn't know that I know so I'm kind of tentatively
sort of talking about it but he erm she fell down the stairs somewhere mm she can move her fingers they don't know if she'll be able to walk and at the moment she's not talking
yeah so his sister flew from Los Angeles was up last week and now they're on winter break so he's there for two weeks
so I don't know if he'll be well I don't know
didn't know she was living in Warsaw
his dad is the head of which is why
yeah so I think he's worked for for some time
and then yeah I dunno where he was before but now he's the head of Poland
very good what did you go for? the spicy chicken?
yeah I love salad so I won't say no
shall we pause this while we're?
cos I'm going to just be very quiet
while we're munching right be back soon
how do you pause? just push that big red button?
one or two and maybe go somewhere for a coffee or not?
I was just thinking where in town does really good coffee that's not a rip-off price? erm
erm I think the hotel is a bit overpriced
and it's not that good what about that erm traditional place that doesn't have a toilet?
let's try there oh no if it's traditional it'll be closed on Saturday afternoon
that's what I thought yeah yeah yeah
erm oh bugger I don't know now erm
I'd like to be somewhere that's not the hotel but where you can sort of look outside
and I think that's only the hotel or the and it's overpriced
or the coffee's reasonable in there
yeah it mean you know it's okay it's not magnificent
you can't really look out there can you?
I don't know or there's a place called or something that I've not been in
yeah okay I've never been in the if we can get a table
if we can get a table I'd like to
I think it's seven złoty and the coffee's brilliant
hope we can get a table
yeah well we can ask the table pixie
I think this was last weekend's Valentine's CD
and they've just left it in the CD player
so when they opened up this Friday Saturday Sunday in the upstairs of the building that's the CD that was left from last weekend I think that's what's happened
mm and this yeah yes there's still lots of Valentine's stuff everywhere
I know I've really not had a lot of chocolate recently apart from this erm I don't know this really dark one with the coffee bean coffee flavour to it
yeah it's dead expensive it's like ten złoty at the bar
yeah I think that's fair enough though I think
I never mind paying for food or drink if it's of really good quality
yeah yeah and it because it's quite expensive it makes me sort of slow down eating it
not really but it not really at all I'm lying
I find with chocolate of that quality I can't handle more than a couple of squares at a time
cos I get such a cocoa high
and I I find er it's also like erm cups of tea I can't have even a square of proper chocolate after six o'clock at night
jeez I think that's happy birthday isn't it?

yeah be interesting if I do get this farming job because erm they have groups visit the farms to learn about organic stuff et cetera et cetera and as an offshoot they like to have natives to teach local children a bit of English no I know
ah I did say I was very well I was diplomatically honest in my introductory letter and said I have no experience of children I didn't say I positively dislike them
erm but yeah I said I have no experience of children and erm
not even of teaching children just of children in general
no I have no experience of children in general full stop
I mean I have a niece

I sort of ignored her until she was old enough to hold a proper conversation erm never held her when she was a baby in fact yeah I was round a friend's house a few months back in Northern Ireland so it must've been before I no yeah it must've been before I left must've been about August time and was introduced to her baby granddaughter and she just sort of plonked this thing
oh no I've never h I've never held a child
in my arms it's like shit what do I do now? you know
bit like Hugh Grant in About a Boy
exactly like Hugh Grant in About a Boy
okay er there's a living thing on me
it's not a cat what do I do with it? yeah
so I dunno but then I was k sort of kind of philosophical about it and thought maybe it's about time that I just face this morbid fear of young people

and I mean you know you do get the occasional young person that I can relate to there's erm another time I stayed on island just north of Northern Ireland it's part of Northern Ireland but it's an island off the north and erm some friends had their niece come and stay while we were staying on the island and she was about seven at the time and apparently completely latched onto me although I didn't notice erm and sort of followed me about and things like that and I saw her again when I was over for the funeral and she's a wonderful young woman
we were able to have er you know quite grown-up conversations about travelling and
really engaged with her but I didn't really notice that she was there erm at the time although at mealtimes I do remember conversing with her and it wasn't as painful as I expected it to be
that was alright but I think that probably says as much and more about her
er cos I think she's always been quite able to
you know hold a lucid conversation even at a young age so
mm mm mm yeah I think it erm if you're an only child
I think it helps if you are always
whereas kids who grow up with brothers and sisters stay younger
because they are left to their own devices they don't have any they don't have any as much adult contact because they have each other
whereas if you're an only child or there's huge age gaps between siblings
yeah nine and a half years between me and my brother
mm yeah if there's a huge age gap then you would spend more time with adults I think than that sibling
yes I mean I'm sure they're very nice
I I think eleven upwards is okay any younger than that

and there's not a lot going on and it depends on upbringing and where they're from some these kids in for example they are twelve or thirteen and there's this boy he'll be maybe thirteen this year he's Italian but he lives in France I think he lives in Paris and he can speak erm well he can speak Italian and French he can speak Dutch I think and English is his fourth language
and he got an A at FCE and he's twelve
oh my god As are like rocking horse shit aren't they?
er and you know so it depends
some of these kids are just frightening frightening
erm but they come from money and like not just a bit rich
the world's super richest children erm I was looking at the fees for this school they've put the fees up erm
they should put your wages up then
well I've got a two hundred pound bonus so I'm not complaining
erm but two weeks at this school to send one child for two weeks it's two and a half thousand pounds
how much of that do you see?
yeah er well I see one child yeah
I get one child to pay
erm for a month and a lot of them come for a month five thousand pounds
wow no discount for doing extra?
no discount for doing it longer no
some of them send a whole family you can have three or four kids from the same family
yeah I guess if money's no object then why not?
but imagine having and it's I mean it's not throwing away money
I mean if I had children and I had money
I'd probably spend it to have them away from me as much as possible
who I've known for the last couple of years erm from Russia
er she spends five weeks in
and five weeks in Bulgaria at tennis camp and that's her summer holiday she doesn't see her parents
her father I think is she's I don't know twelve or thirteen her er f her father is in his sixties I think
erm and she's quite close to her sister who's in her thirties
so her sister comes and visits her sister lives in but this kid she's just like shipped away
and I think they probably a lot of them live at boarding school as well
yeah so actually yeah I think I'd just not have children rather than pay to get rid of them
yeah ppay to have someone else look after them
send them to boarding school send them to a different country on summer holidays
but if you've got the choice

no I think my issue with children particularly young children it's a bit like I can sort of relate it to dogs as well you know with dogs it's there's a level of unconsciousness that does my head in you know when they're just barking
and they're off their heads they're not really focusing on what's going on
in well at least reality as I perceive it and I see a lot of children doing that as well
if it's like they're being like a cat when it's chasing a leaf so it's like so focused
in that now moment it's having a lot of fun that I can engage with
but quite often there's just like a lot of bullshit chatter and squealing that
reminds me of a dog that's just barking its head off
so if they're being like a cat fine if they're being like a dog no
irritating as hell get them out of my face
I think a lot of er I don't know I think a lot of people really kind of er baby children too much

like I've worked with people who you know they have this sort of primary school teacher voice and it's all very soft and sweet and er you know as soon as they can talk they can talk to them like they're actual
I think the ythe younger that you talk to them like adults
then the sort of the better
that I don't mind so much you know if I if there's a y a small person and I can have a grown-up conversation with them
you know that I can handle
but I think yeah as early as possible to start to take the piss out of them a little bit
just train them up for life that's my advice
in my experience with er children and teenagers
just take the piss as much as you can they like it they do they do
yeah I dunno I don't know
so what are you doing when you get back later?
a bit of tidying and then I don't know just I'm not gonna start doing any work tonight I'm just gonna kind of organise it a little bit
find these essays that I've got to mark put everything in the right place
I can give you cash if you wanna put it all on your card?
I dunno what mine was mind you
mine was fifty I think which is very expensive
yeah we went for the pricey option well it's the juice was about eighteen
and I think my main was about twenty-two or more
yeah mine was thirty-two I think last night I paid twenty-five
in the Mexican place and I thought that was expensive spoiling myself
I really you know again I really don't mind for
do you want to see my new socks?
yeah show me your new socks
er just in a cheap high street place I like them cos they've got fruit on them they're just for the gym
that's a kiwi very nice and are we a hundred percent cotton? soak up all that sweat
they're quite cool actually as far as those short socks things go
five-pack one size oh big money twenty-three złoty bloody hell
I know I'm treating myself you can't get cheap socks here
erm you know in when you go in through the door?
yeah you I've got five pairs for four złoty yesterday
did they have fruit on them?
no and they weren't the size that they said they were on the packet
so I put a sock on this morning and it was enormous
so I took it off again and put all five pairs in the charity bag
so oh well it's only like a couple of quid
someone's gonna have some warm feet
what's that? one pound eighty or something?
I didn't really think to go in there I only go in for like
no don't don't go in there
for you know homeware bits and pieces
I don't think they're very healthy
socks made in China ninety-eight percent polyester bugger they're gonna stink after a workout but they're very nice
you know I'm still living by this does it spark joy? rule
I really like that I think if you're gonna have one rule in life cos I you know I'm just a rule breaker frankly but if you're gonna have one rule in life let it be that
yeah and you can apply it to everything to people
does this person spark joy? no drop dead then
